description: Daily gratitude journaling app - write what you're grateful for, view calendar history. Local-only, mobile-first, pastel theme.

userStories.title: Write Today's Gratitude Entry
userStories.description: As a user, I want to write what I'm grateful for today so I can reflect on positive moments
acceptanceCriteria: "Today" view displays current date prominently
Large text area (min 3 rows) for gratitude entry
Character limit: 500 characters with live counter
Counter shows remaining characters
Counter turns orange at 50 chars remaining, red at 10
Entry auto-saves on blur (no explicit save button needed)
Entry persists in localStorage

security: Local-only app with no backend: No authentication required (local-only data), no API endpoints to secure, no sensitive data transmitted over network, localStorage data accessible only to same origin, XSS prevention via React's built-in escaping. Input validation: Character limit enforced client-side (500 chars), HTML escaping handled by React (automatic). Browser security: localStorage scoped to domain (same-origin policy), no third-party scripts loaded, CSP headers configured.
mobile: Touch interactions: All buttons/tabs 44x44px minimum touch target, text area large and easy to tap (full-width minus padding), calendar cells 48x48px minimum. Responsive layout: Primary design for 375px-428px (iPhone SE to Pro Max), no horizontal scrolling on any viewport, text area scales to fill available height. Performance: Static site (no server requests after initial load), auto-save debounced (reduce localStorage writes), calendar renders only visible month. Accessibility: Touch targets meet iOS/Android guidelines, color contrast meets WCAG AA standards, font sizes readable on mobile (18px minimum), tab navigation reachable with thumb on bottom of screen.
operations: Deployment: Vercel (recommended) via GitHub integration, static export (no server-side rendering), CDN distribution. Environment variables: None required (local-only app). Build command: npm run build. Output directory: out/ (Next.js static export). Health check: N/A (static site, no backend), monitor via Vercel uptime monitoring. Monitoring: Vercel Analytics for page views (optional), Browser DevTools for client-side errors, localStorage usage monitoring (warn at 4MB of 5MB limit). Scaling: N/A (static site scales automatically via CDN). Maintenance: localStorage limit warning, browser compatibility testing (Chrome, Safari, Firefox latest 2 versions), data migration function if schema changes. Troubleshooting: localStorage full warning, data corruption validation with reset to empty state. Backup: N/A (local-only app, users can manually export data in future feature).
implementation: Tech stack: Next.js 14+ App Router, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, localStorage, Vercel deployment. File structure: src/app/ (layout, page, today/, calendar/), src/components/ (TodayView, CalendarView, TabNavigation, CharacterCounter), src/lib/storage.ts (localStorage helpers), src/types/index.ts. Data model: localStorage key 'gratitude-entries' with version 'v1' and entries object { 'YYYY-MM-DD': 'entry text' }. Key functions: saveEntry, getEntry, getAllEntries, getDatesWithEntries. Performance: Auto-save debounced 500ms, calendar renders only current month, localStorage limit check before write (~5MB), lazy load calendar view.
